bug.author: tadejsv
bug.summary: Viewing validation statistics by epoch (on x-axis) broken in Wandb
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
Here's the <denchmark-link:https://colab.research.google.com/drive/1h8KbopeAidzcLc8w7uxiOGftaoztJdMV?usp=sharing>boring model</denchmark-link> . If you want to view the charts in Weights and Biases with epoch on the X-axis, you get a message that there is "no data availible". Viewing with the step/global step on the X-axis still works. See the two images below:
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11489772/96338781-a8e75500-1090-11eb-8aef-ca72102a7e80.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11489772/96338782-a8e75500-1090-11eb-8f7f-52cbca131293.png></denchmark-link>
I suspect this is related to the values that PL sends with the logs, for example this is what the CSVLogger produces: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11489772/96338780-a84ebe80-1090-11eb-9fe5-7723e40c3f54.png></denchmark-link>
For some strange reason, there is no epoch value for validation data - the place that should definitely have it... This bug is extremely annoying if you are, for example, experimenting with different batch sizes - then just comparing steps is meaningless... <denchmark-h:h3>Environment</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>* CUDA: - GPU: - Tesla T4 - available: True - version: 10.1 * Packages: - numpy: 1.18.5 - pyTorch_debug: False - pyTorch_version: 1.6.0+cu101 - pytorch-lightning: 1.0.2 - tqdm: 4.41.1 * System: - OS: Linux - architecture: - 64bit - - processor: x86_64 - python: 3.6.9 - version: #1 SMP Thu Jul 23 08:00:38 PDT 2020 </denchmark-code>
P.S.: Default PL in boring model should be changed to 1.0.2.
